channel.title: Could not reserve enough heap memory
channel.description: I know what it means... It means my VPS cannot withstand grabbing all this memory... Im just wondering if there was anyway we could lower the memory usage for RSCA?? When I lower the stuff to lower standards and everything I get: [code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: rsca/ls/Server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: rsca.ls.Server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: rsca.ls.Server. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . . [/code] same with GS

item.title: Could not reserve enough heap memory
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

You defined more max memory to the application then your VPS/home PC has. -xmx option or something like that @ build file (if you’re using ANT).

Read full topic
item.source: Could not reserve enough heap memory

item.title: Could not reserve enough heap memory
item.dc:creator: @Nemesis1 Nemesis-
item.description:
@Nemesis1 wrote:

[quote=“bigballers, post:1, topic:356974”]I know what it means… It means my VPS cannot withstand grabbing all this memory… Im just wondering if there was anyway we could lower the memory usage for RSCA??
When I lower the stuff to lower standards and everything I get:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: rsca/ls/Server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: rsca.ls.Server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: rsca.ls.Server. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .
same with GS[/quote]
Looks like you haven’t compiled it.

@bigballers wrote:

I know what it means… It means my VPS cannot withstand grabbing all this memory… Im just wondering if there was anyway we could lower the memory usage for RSCA??
When I lower the stuff to lower standards and everything I get:
